title.title: Tube upgrade plan - check before you travel

texts: The Tube is undergoing a huge and essential programme to upgrade its ageing infrastructure - vital to cope with a growing population and to support the economic development and growth of the capital and the UK.

The Tube is undergoing a huge and essential programme to upgrade its ageing infrastructure - vital to cope with a growing population and to support the economic development and growth of the capital and the UK.
The benefits for Londoners will be great, with more trains - many with air-conditioning - delivering faster, more frequent and reliable journeys.
The Tube upgrade will mean a big increase in capacity of around 30 per cent.
This bulletin includes information about planned LU improvement works, as well as those on London Overground, London Tramlink and Docklands Light Railway.
We know that closures are frustrating, so TfL is working hard to keep disruption to a minimum and to provide information and alternative travel options.
Londoners and visitors to the city are urged to 'check before you travel', particularly at weekends, and to allow extra journey time where necessary.
TfL's range of Travel Tools help passengers plan journeys, get travel information on the move and work out the best way home at www.tfl.gov.uk/tfl/traveltools
The website also provides full information on bus replacement services during works.
Passengers can check www.tfl.gov.uk/check before travelling, or use the following options:

For more information on the Tube upgrade plan please go to: www.tfl.gov.uk/tubeupgradeplan
Blackfriars Tube station on theDistrict and Circle lines will be closed until late this year for Network Rail Thameslink redevelopment works.
Cannon Street Tube station on theDistrict and Circle lines will be closed every weekend until mid-2012 for redevelopment works.
Farringdon Tube station on theCircle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines will be closed all weekend due to station improvement works.
Northern line trains will not stop at Tottenham Court Road until late November due to station improvement work.
The Bakerloo Line will be suspended on Sunday between Queen's Park and Harrow & Wealdstone due to Network Rail engineering work.
The Circle line will be suspended all weekend due to track replacement work and Thameslink redevelopment work at Blackfriars and Farringdon.

The District line will be suspended all weekend between Embankment and East Ham due to Tube and Network Rail track replacement work at Mile End and West Ham and Thameslink redevelopment work at Blackfriars.

The Hammersmith & City line will be suspended all weekend between King's Cross St Pancras and Barking due to Tube and Network Rail track replacement work at Mile End and West Ham, and Thameslink work at Farringdon.

The Metropolitan line will be suspended all weekend between Northwood and Amersham/Chesham/Watford (no fast service north of Harrow-on-the-Hill) due to line upgrade work and between Baker Street and Aldgate due to Thameslink work at Farringdon.
